body.p: During the second year of the contract, the customer continues to use the entity’s patent, but the customer’s financial condition declines. The customer’s current access to credit and available cash on hand are limited. The entity continues to recognise revenue on the basis of the customer’s usage throughout the second year. The customer pays the first quarter’s royalties but makes nominal payments for the usage of the patent in Quarters 2–4. The entity accounts for any impairment of the existing receivable in accordance with IFRS 9 Financial Instruments.
